entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character in the story, referred to as 'Harry' by Ron. (Excerpt: 'This is a joke, right? You’re joking.' - Harry said)

entities.name: ron
entities.description: One of Harry's friends, who falls in love with an unnamed girl. (Excerpts: 'I think ... Harry , I think I love her,' - Ron said; 'Have you seen her hair...?' - Ron asked)

entities.name: the girl
entities.description: The object of Ron's affections, described as having black and shiny hair and big dark eyes. (Excerpts: 'Her big dark eyes? And her –' - Ron said; 'Have you seen her hair...?' - Ron asked)

relationships.description: Harry and Ron are friends, as evidenced by their conversation. (Excerpt: 'They stared at each other for almost a whole minute...')
Harry is familiar with the girl Ron has fallen in love with, as evidenced by his reaction to Ron's confession. (Excerpt: 'This is really funny and everything,' - Harry said)
Ron has developed romantic feelings for the girl, as evidenced by his confession to Harry. (Excerpts: 'I think ... Harry , I think I love her,' - Ron said; 'Have you seen her hair...?' - Ron asked)
Harry becomes angry with Ron when he realizes that Ron is serious about his confession. (Excerpt: 'He turned to leave; he had got two steps towards the door...')
Harry becomes defensive when Ron hits him with a crashing blow. (Excerpt: 'Staggering, he looked round. Ron’s fist was drawn right back...')
